definition[0]: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression
example[0]: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
example[1]: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally  (=I did not mean exactly what I said)!
definition[1]: used to emphasize that something, especially a large number, is actually true
example[2]: The Olympic Games were watched by literally billions of people.
definition[2]: used to emphasize a strong expression or word that is not being used in its real or original meaning. Some people consider this use to be incorrect
example[3]: Dad was literally blazing with anger.
